00031 // Making a route
00032 route_t *make_route(char *net, char *mask, char *iface, char *gateway,        \
00033                     char *flags, char *metric, char *ref, char *use)
00034 {
00035   route_t *route_entry = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00036 
00037   route_entry->net = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00038   route_entry->mask = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00039   route_entry->iface = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00040   route_entry->gateway = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00041   route_entry->flags = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00042   route_entry->metric = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00043   route_entry->ref = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00044   route_entry->use = (char *)malloc(BUFFER*sizeof(char));
00045 
00046   strcpy(route_entry->net, net);
00047   strcpy(route_entry->mask, mask);
00048   strcpy(route_entry->iface, iface);
00049   strcpy(route_entry->gateway, gateway);
00050   strcpy(route_entry->flags, flags);
00051   strcpy(route_entry->metric, metric);
00052   strcpy(route_entry->ref, ref);
00053   strcpy(route_entry->use, use);
00054   route_entry->next = NULL;
00055   route_entry->previous = NULL;
00056 
00057   return route_entry;
00058 }

00062 // Initial loading of route table from a given file
00063 void load_routes(route_table_t *table, const char *filename)
00064 {
00065   FILE          *f;
00066   int           type = 0;
00067   int           not_entry = 1;
00068   char          net[BUFFER];
00069   char          mask[BUFFER];
00070   char          iface[BUFFER];
00071   char          gateway[BUFFER];
00072   char          flags[BUFFER];
00073   char          metric[BUFFER];
00074   char          ref[BUFFER];
00075   char          use[BUFFER];
00076 
00077 
00078   cout << "Loading route table from " << filename << endl;
00079   if((f = fopen(filename, "r")) == NULL)
00080     cout << filename << " cannot be opened" << endl;
00081 
00082   fseek(f, 0, SEEK_SET);
00083 
00084   while(!feof(f)) {
00085     if(not_entry) {
00086       fscanf(f, "%s", net);
00087       if((strchr(net, '.') != NULL) || (strcmp(net, "default") == 0)) {
00088         not_entry = 0;
00089         type++;
00090       }
00091     }
00092     else {
00093       switch(type) {                    // Once the pointer gets into the table
00094         case NET: {
00095           fscanf(f, "%s", net);
00096         } break;
00097         case GATEWAY: {
00098           fscanf(f, "%s", gateway);
00099         } break;
00100         case MASK: {
00101           fscanf(f, "%s", mask);
00102         } break;
00103         case FLAGS: {
00104           fscanf(f, "%s", flags);
00105         } break;
00106         case METRIC: {
00107           fscanf(f, "%s", metric);
00108         } break;
00109         case REF: {
00110           fscanf(f, "%s", ref);
00111         } break;
00112         case USE: {
00113           fscanf(f, "%s", use);
00114         } break;
00115         case IFACE: {
00116           fscanf(f, "%s", iface);
00117         } break;
00118         default: {}
00119       }
00120 
00121       type++;
00122       if(type == 8) {                   // Finish reading one row
00123         type = 0;
00124         add_route(table, net, gateway, mask, flags,                             \
00125                   metric, ref, use, iface);
00126       }
00127     }
00128   }
00129 
00130   fclose(f);
00131   return;
00132 }

00136 // Checking if a route_table is empty
00137 // if empty return 1
00138 // if not empty return 0
00139 int is_empty(route_table_t *table)
00140 {
00141   if(table->first == NULL)
00142     return 1;
00143 
00144   return 0;
00145 }

00149 // Adding a route to the route table
00150 void add_route(route_table_t *table, char *net, char *gateway, char *mask,      \
00151                char *flags, char *metric, char *ref,                            \
00152                char *use, char *iface)
00153 {
00154   route_t *current = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00155   current = make_route(net, mask, iface, gateway, flags, metric, ref, use);
00156 
00157   if(strcmp(current->net, "default") == 0)
00158     table->deflt = current;
00159 
00160   if(is_empty(table)) {
00161     table->first = current;
00162     table->last = current;
00163   }
00164   else {
00165     current->previous = table->last;
00166     table->last->next = current;
00167         table->last = current;
00168   }
00169   return;
00170 }

00174 // Looking for a match
00175 // Criteria is longest match
00176 // If no match use default
00177 // If two routes have the same match length just take the first occurance
00178 route_t *match_route(route_table_t *table, char *net_addr)
00179 {
00180   int match_count = 0;
00181   int max_match = 0;
00182   route_t *matched = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00183   route_t *current = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00184 
00185   current = table->first;
00186   while(current->next != NULL) {
00187     if(strcmp(current->net, net_addr) == 0) {
00188       matched = current;
00189       free(current);
00190       return matched;
00191     }
00192     else {
00193       match_count = match_func(current->net, net_addr);
00194       if(match_count > max_match) {
00195         max_match = match_count;
00196         matched = current;
00197       }
00198     }
00199     current = current->next;
00200   }
00201 
00202   if(max_match == 0)
00203     matched = table->deflt;
00204   return matched;
00205 }

00209 // Deleting an entry from the route table
00210 void del_route(route_table_t *table, char *net_addr)
00211 {
00212   route_t *current = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00213 
00214   current = table->first;
00215 
00216   while(current != NULL) {
00217     if(strcmp(net_addr, current->net) == 0) {
00218       if(current == table->first) {
00219         table->first = table->first->next;
00220         table->first->previous = NULL;
00221       }
00222       else if (current == table->last) {
00223         table->last = table->last->previous;
00224         table->last->next = NULL;
00225       }
00226       else {
00227         current->previous->next = current->next;
00228         current->next->previous = current->previous;
00229       }
00230       free(current);
00231       return;
00232     }
00233 
00234     current = current->next;
00235   }
00236   cout << "Network address " << net_addr << " not in the routing table" << endl;
00237   return;
00238 }

00242 // Printing routes in the route table
00243 void print_route(route_table_t *table)
00244 {
00245   route_t *current = (route_t *)malloc(sizeof(route_t));
00246 
00247   current = table->first;
00248   if(current == NULL) {
00249     cout << "Route table is empty" << endl;
00250     free(current);
00251     return;
00252   }
00253 
00254   cout << "\nNet\t\t\tGateway\t\tMask\t\tFlag Met Ref Use Iface" << endl;
00255   while(current != NULL) {
00256     printf("%15s %18s %18s %5s %3s %3s %3s %5s\n", current->net,                \
00257            current->gateway, current->mask, current->flags,                     \
00258            current-> metric, current->ref, current->use, current->iface);
00259 
00260     current = current->next;
00261   }
00262 
00263   free(current);
00264   return;
00265 }

00270 
00271 // Matching function to be used by match_route
00272 // Count the number of dots in the network address
00273 // up to which the addresses still match
00274 // As soon as a mismatch occur, stop
00275 int match_func(const char *entry_net, const char *net)
00276 {
00277   int i = 0;
00278   int match_count = 0;
00279   int str_len = (((strlen(entry_net)) < (strlen(net))) ?                        \
00280                   (strlen(entry_net)) : (strlen(net)));
00281 
00282   while(i <str_len) {
00283     if(entry_net[i] == '.') {
00284       match_count++;
00285       i++;
00286     }
00287     else if(entry_net[i] != net[i])
00288       return match_count;
00289 
00290     i++;
00291   }
00292 
00293   return match_count;
00294 }

00297 char *ipToString(IPAddress ip)
00298 {
00299   struct in_addr addr;
00300   addr.s_addr = htonl(ip.addr);
00301   return inet_ntoa(addr);
00302 }

00343 void add_intface(if_list_t *if_list, char *name, char *status, char *IPAddr,    \
00344                         char *NetAddr)
00345 {
00346   intface_t *current = (intface_t *)malloc(sizeof(intface_t));
00347   current = make_intface(name, status, IPAddr, NetAddr);
00348 
00349   if(is_empty_list(if_list)) {
00350     if_list->first = current;

00352   }

00354     current->previous = if_list->last;

00362 void del_intface(if_list_t *if_list, char *name)
00363 {
00364   intface_t *current = (intface_t *)malloc(sizeof(intface_t));
00365 
00366   current = if_list->first;
00367

00369     if(strcmp(name, current->name) == 0) {
00370       if(current == if_list->first) {
00371         if_list->first = if_list->first->next;
00372         if_list->first->previous = NULL;
00373       }
00374       else if (current == if_list->last) {
00375         if_list->last = if_list->last->previous;
00376         if_list->last->next = NULL;
00377       }
00378       else {
00379         current->previous->next = current->next;
00380         current->next->previous = current->previous;
00381       }
00382       free(current);
00383       return;
00384     }
00385 
00386     current = current->next;
00387   }
00388   cout << "interface " << name << " not in the list" << endl;
